intro: Eriogonum lachnogynum var. colobum, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive shape, while its stems are erect and branched. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various pollinators and wildlife.
